Package org.eso.ias.plugin.filter

Class FilterBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eso.ias.plugin.filter.FilterBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AverageBySamples, AverageByTime, NoneFilter
    public abstract class FilterBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter
    The basic class for the filters.

    FilterBase keeps a time ordered history of samples: newest items are in the head of the list.

    Implementation of filters must take care of removing elements from the history when a new element is added (sampleAdded(org.eso.ias.plugin.filter.Filter.EnrichedSample)) and/or when the filtered value is retrieved Filter.apply().

    Objects of this class stores also:

    • the point in time when the last sample had been submitted (lastSampleSubmssionTime
    • the last filtered value returned applying the filter lastReturnedValue

    The filtering is not supposed to perform any I/O but to perform the calculation only on the samples in the history.

    Author:
    acaproni

      • apply

        public final java.util.Optional<FilteredValue> apply()
        Apply the filter to the samples in the history and return the filtered value or empty if there are no samples in the history.

        The calculation of the filter is delegated to applyFilter().

        Specified by:
        apply in interface Filter
        Returns:
        The value after applying the filter

        The new sample is added at the head.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • removeLastSamples

        protected int removeLastSamples​(int nSamples)
        Remove the last nSamples from the history.

        The removal proceed from the tail that contains the oldest samples.

        Returns:
        The number of removed samples

      • historySnapshot

        protected java.util.List<Filter.EnrichedSample> historySnapshot()
        historySnapshot returns a snapshot of the actual history that is part of the FilteredValue returned by apply().

        The collection is a read-only view of a copy of the .history

        Returns:
        a read-only snapshot of the actual history
